benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/credits/{creditId} - Retrieve a credit by id

covered: Valid Request: TC01 and TC02 cover successful retrieval for CREDIT_ADJ and CBA_ADJ types with correct 200 responses and JSON InvoiceItem objects.
Empty Response: TC03 covers case where no InvoiceItem of type CREDIT_ADJ or CBA_ADJ exists, returning 404 with credit-not-found message.
Query Parameters: TC08 tests ignoring extra unexpected query parameters and still returns valid InvoiceItem JSON with 200.
Authorization: TC06 and TC07 cover missing and expired/invalid authentication tokens with 401.
Security tests: TC12 (SQL injection) and TC13 (XSS) check invalid inputs and system resilience, plus TC16/TC17 cover invalid/edge input formats.
Boundary/invalid input coverage: TC05 (invalid UUID format 400), TC14 (very large UUID 404), TC16 (truncated UUID 400), TC17 (whitespace-padded UUID 400).
Availability/Degraded/Down scenarios: TC09 (performance under load) asserts response within time, TC10 (DB unavailable) returns 503.
Backward compatibility: TC20 covers API backward compatibility with 200 and JSON object.
gaps: Pagination: There is no test for pagination handling when there are many credits (large datasets).
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for rate limiting/throttling under burst of requests (beyond TC09 performance timing).
Unauthorized access beyond 401/403 distinction not explicitly tested (e.g., 403 for insufficient scope/permissions).
Edge-case when system is empty beyond “no credits at all” (TC18) could be expanded with different empty-state responses across environments.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests to ensure correct handling of large result sets (limit/offset or page size).
Add tests validating caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) and conditional requests (If-None-Match).
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under bursts (e.g., returning 429 or appropriate throttle response).
Clarify/extend authorization tests to cover insufficient permissions (e.g., 403) and role-based access control nuances.
Extend empty-state scenarios (TC18) across different data seeding configurations to ensure consistent 404 vs. other responses.
